dcterms:creator: J. M. Zacks
K. M. Swallow
dcterms:description: Event Segmentation Theory (EST) suggests that we utilize temporary increases in prediction errors for segmenting the stream of sensorimotor information into separable events.
dcterms:title: Event Segmentation Theory (EST)

dcterms:creator: M. V. Butz
D. Bilkey
D. Humaidan
A. Knott
S. Otte
dcterms:description: REPRISE is a retrospec-tive and prospective inference scheme that shows promising planning and event-inference abilities.
dcterms:title: REPRISE

dcterms:creator: T. Asabuki
N. Hiratani
T. Fukai
dcterms:description: Interactive reservoir computing is used for chunking information streams, allowing for the identification of event boundaries.
dcterms:title: Interactive reservoir computing

dcterms:creator: C. Baldassano
U. Hasson
K. A. Norman
dcterms:description: Real-world event schemas are represented during narrative perception, showing different brain activity patterns for different ongoing contexts.
dcterms:title: Real-world event schemas

dcterms:creator: M. Botvinick
Y. Niv
A. C. Barto
dcterms:description: Hierarchically organized behavior is explored from a reinforcement learning perspective, discussing its neural foundations.
dcterms:title: Hierarchically organized behavior

dcterms:creator: K. A. Pettijohn
A. N. Thompson
A. K. Tamplin
S. A. Krawietz
G. A. Radvansky
dcterms:description: Event boundaries have been shown to positively affect memory improvement.
dcterms:title: Event boundaries and memory improvement

dcterms:creator: J. R. Reynolds
J. M. Zacks
T. S. Braver
dcterms:description: A computational model of event segmentation from perceptual prediction is presented, exploring how events are segmented based on prediction errors.
dcterms:title: Computational model of event segmentation
